messages.subject: Fw: [homeschoolingmoms] Fwd: Fw: 1st Graders 11-15-99
messages.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: Tina Campbell <t_campbell66@...>
To: <dbsokie@...>; <homeschoolingmoms@egroups.com>;
<andyjay68@...>; <Kfoxdel1353@...>;
<bonney_k@...>; <maryzandfamily@...>;
<sonshine@...>; <samwell@...>; <gmweldy@...>
Sent: Tuesday, November 16, 1999 6:51 PM
Subject: [homeschoolingmoms] Fwd: Fw: 1st Graders 11-15-99


>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> Subject: Fw: 1st Graders
>
>
> > To All:
> > Thought this was good enough to pass along. Enjoy!
> >
> > A first grade teacher collected well-known proverbs. She gave each
child
> >
> > in her class the first half of a proverb and had them come up with the
> > rest. Their insight may surprise you.
> >
> > Better to be safe than . . . . . punch a 5th grader.
> >
> > Strike while the . . . . . bug is close.
> >
> > It's always darkest before . . . . . Daylight Savings Time.
> >
> > Never underestimate the power of . . . . . termites.
> >
> > Don't bite the hand that . . . . looks dirty.
> >
> > No news is . . . . . impossible.
> >
> > If you lie down with dogs you'll . . . . stink in the morning.
> >
> > Love all, trust . . . . me.
> >
> > The pen is mightier than the . . . . . pigs.
> >
> > An idle mind is . . . . . the best way to relax.
> >
> > Happy the bride who . . . . . gets all the presents.
> >
> > A penny saved is . . . . . not much.
> >
> > Two's company, three's . . . . the Musketeers. ( personal favorite)
> >
> > Don't put off till tomorrow what . . . . . you put on to go to bed.
> >
> > Laugh and the whole world laughs with you, cry and . . . . . you have
to
> >
> > blow your nose.
> >
> > Children should be seen and not . . . . . spanked or grounded.
> >
> > When the blind lead the blind . . . . . get out of the way
> >
> >
> > ----------------- End Forwarded Message -----------------
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
>
>
>
>
